oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 11 e. Newspaper clipping: Ex-Gov. Patterson Asked For Suffrage Views By Mrs. French. October 22, 1915.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ex-Gov. Patterson Asked For Suffrage Views By Mrs. French. Mrs. L. Crozier French, president of the Knoxville Equal Suffrage league and one of the pioneer workers for suffrage in the state of Tennessee, never lets pass an opportunity to work for the cause. Since first embracing the movement Mrs. French has done much active work and the Equal Suffrage league, under her direction, is planning an active campaign for the coming year. The following telegram has been sent to Gov. M. R. Patterson at Nash ville, and local members are awaiting with interest his answer: "Gov. M. R. Patterson, Nashville, Tenn. "We are surprised that you failed to declare in favor of woman's suffrage, in your Nashville address. Will you favor us with a declaration as to whether you approve or disapprove vote for women? "MRS. L. C. FRENCH, "President Knoxville Equal Suffrage League."
